"Buried" is an understatement.

Battle Update!

RIMS terrier was badly damaged in the last turn. More importantly than the loss of its front armor, all of the internal fuel tanks were destroyed. The only fuel left was in the missile's tank. But wait? What's that thing labelled "RIMS Terrier Probe"? It's the other missile! Containing, most importantly, more fuel.

After grabbing the missile, Terrier heads off to get revenge on the higher-orbiting frigate. It fires its I-beam rockets first. If I can kill the ship without using my guided missiles I might be able to dock to more fuel... They don't do much damage to the ship. The rest of the fuel is transferred into one missile and it is launched. Another solid hit, these seem to kill the frigates very efficiently. I got a good shot of the explosion this time.

Terrier is now considered dead, it has no more usable weapons and no fuel remaining.

I then went back to check on the ammo of the other remaining frigate, it's out of ammo. I guess that means I win? PERSISTENT, if you think you can still do something with it.
